::Squizzy::

She stepped back and pressed her back against the pod.  She was 
getting nervous.  She didn't know who these bots were, or what they 
were.  She had no clue who she was really.  SHe had most of her 
memory ereased in the crash.  She looked at them and trembled 
slightly. "Where am I? What is this place?"

She walked along the side of the pod.  She got to end, looked at the 
other bots, then bolted away from them.  She ran as fast as she 
could. 



--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, "Jonathan Hogan" <jhogan@r...> wrote:
> > Arcangel and depth Charge:
> >
> >
> > "who are you and what side are you on?"
> >
> 
> {Thrash}
> 
>     Thrash was tearing across the landscape, his metallic fins 
sawing
> through trees and other foilage when he came upon a rather odd 
scene. Three
> bots outside a stasis pod were talking, the stasis pod itself seemed
> undamaged and appeared open. Even as the giant shark transformed 
landing a
> small distance from the group a laser pistol appeared in his hand, 
a minor
> weapon compared to what two of the bots seemed to carry but such 
facts
> nevered deterred Thrash, slowly he approached keeping his eyes on 
all and
> none, "Who are you bots?"
